title: Celebrity Cruises to jettison history-filled restaurants
text:
The S.S. United States Restaurant on the 2,158-passenger Celebrity Infinity. (Photo: Celebrity Cruises)
48 CONNECT 12 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE An elegant restaurant on one of Celebrity Cruises' oldest ships designed as an homage to the famed S.S. United States soon will be no more.
Celebrity on Thursday announced it would replace the S.S. United States Restaurant on the 2,170-passenger Celebrity Infinity with an Italian steakhouse.
The S.S. United States Restaurant features original, etched glass panels salvaged from the 1950s ocean liner -- an icon of American shipbuilding that retains the record for fastest crossing of the Atlantic. The ship stopped sailing in 1969 but remains docked in Philadelphia amidst efforts to permanently save it.
Celebrity on Thursday also said it would replace The Normandie restaurant on the 2,158-passenger Celebrity Summit with the same Italian steakhouse planned for the Infinity.

World's largest cruise ship gets a major makeover
The Normandie restaurant features original paneling and ornamentation from the celebrated S.S. Normandie, an icon of French passenger shipping that operated in the 1930s.
The Italian eateries that will take the place of the historic restaurants will be updated versions of the Tuscan Grille restaurants found on several other Celebrity ships.
Celebrity says maritime artifacts including an original place setting from the S.S. United States currently in the S.S. United States Restaurant on Celebrity Infinity will be moved to an area at the entrance to the ship's casino. Artifacts from the S.S. Normandie in The Normandie restaurant also will be retained in a new display area.
The new eateries will be added as part of minor overhauls of the two ships planned for 2016 that also will include the addition of new rooftop terraces and updated suites.
